events.description: The release of Mexico's consumer sentiment data for January 2026, showing a decline to the lowest level since late 2022.

facts.fact_text: Mexico’s Consumer Confidence Index fell 0.6 points month-on-month to 44.0 in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Mexico’s Consumer Confidence Index fell 0.6 points month-on-month to 44.0 in January 2026

facts.fact_text: The sub-index for the current economic situation of the country declined 0.5 points to 38.8.

evidences.evidence_text: The sub-index for the current economic situation of the country declined 0.5 points to 38.8

facts.fact_text: Households’ current ability to purchase durable goods slipped 0.4 points to 30.5.

evidences.evidence_text: Households’ current ability to purchase durable goods slipped 0.4 points to 30.5.

facts.fact_text: On an annual basis, consumer confidence was down 2.7 points.

evidences.evidence_text: On an annual basis, consumer confidence was down 2.7 points.

claims.claim_text: The assessment of the current household economic situation remained above the optimism threshold.

evidences.evidence_text: the assessment of the current household economic situation fell 0.9 points but remained above the optimism threshold at 50.3

evidence.evidence_text: Mexico’s Consumer Confidence Index fell 0.6 points month-on-month to 44.0 in January 2026, the lowest reading since December 2022.
Households’ current ability to purchase durable goods slipped 0.4 points to 30.5.
